result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jean Carlo Acosta

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jean Carlo Acosta in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Jean Carlo Acosta.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference. Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jean C Acosta in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke,appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NA (10/04/1993).  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Jean C Acosta in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Jean C Acosta in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jean C Acosta appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Proposed No Contact/No Firearms Order.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
